titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1433) to provide for the treatment of the District of Columbia as a Congressional district for purposes of representation in the House of Representatives, and for other purposes.

Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1433) to provide for the treatment of the District of Columbia as a Congressional district for purposes of representation in the House of Representatives, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-63, by Mr. Arcuri.

All points of order against consideration of the bill are waived except those arising under clause 9 or 10 or rule XXI. All points of order against the bill, as amended, are waived. The amendment printed in the report of the Committee on Rules accompanying this resolution shall

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 28.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 260.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 228 - 198 (Roll no. 179).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 226 - 195 (Roll no. 180).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 1433 (District of Columbia House Voting Rights Act of 2007).
